summary: Para la versión de esta página en español, ver a GAO-23-106871 . The United States has provided Mexico over $3 billion in assistance since 2008 to address transnational organized crime and violence, enhance the rule of law, and reduce drug trafficking. Despite U.S. assistance, Mexico's security situation has worsened significantly, with the country's murder rate more than tripling. The State Department and the U.S. Agency...
title: U.S. Assistance to Mexico: State Department Should Take Steps to Assess Overall Progress
